title: How to Make a Tart Crust

steps.headline: Mix the butter, sugar, salt, lemon zest, and vanilla extract until creamy and smooth.
Add eggs a little at a time.
Add flour and salt until just incorporated.
steps.description: Do this slowly so you do not over mix.

steps.headline: Shape dough into flat disks, wrap with saran wrap, and chill until dough is firm.
Roll dough out on a lightly floured surface.
steps.description: Make sure dough is just larger than your pan. Press the dough into the sides of the pan, just like making a pie. Gently roll rolling pin along the top of the tart pan to trim excess dough.

steps.headline: Dock with fork by placing a few small holes in the bottom of the dough to allow air through.
Blind Bake at 350 °F (177 °C) for about 20 minutes, or until crust is lightly browned.
Once the shell has cooled, fill it with your favorite items.
steps.description: Simple ideas include vanilla pudding topped with fresh sliced fruits or chocolate mousse topped with chopped nuts.

text: Mix the butter, sugar, salt, lemon zest, and vanilla extract until creamy and smooth.  Add eggs a little at a time.  Add flour and salt until just incorporated. Do this slowly so you do not over mix. Shape dough into flat disks, wrap with saran wrap, and chill until dough is firm.  Roll dough out on a lightly floured surface. Make sure dough is just larger than your pan. Press the dough into the sides of the pan, just like making a pie. Gently roll rolling pin along the top of the tart pan to trim excess dough. Let dough rest 20-30 minutes.  Dock with fork by placing a few small holes in the bottom of the dough to allow air through.  Blind Bake at 350 °F (177 °C) for about 20 minutes, or until crust is lightly browned.  Once the shell has cooled, fill it with your favorite items. Simple ideas include vanilla pudding topped with fresh sliced fruits or chocolate mousse topped with chopped nuts.
